comment: Not worth the time. No heads up given for any course work: deadlines, homework, etc. Purely read off Powerpoints. All attendance was based on random things that weren't discussed in class. Did not grade majority of work and gave everyone A's at the end. Nothing gained from this class.

Took Guru for summer semester and he showed up half way due to a family matter. We had to finish one project the week that he returned with no context. He was unaware of timing and also had to rush the other final project. Truly didn't create clear deadlines. Attendance wasn't taken except the first day. Just know your partners and trust
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Took him for thermo in the summer. He is a good professor. Really chill and laid back. The lectures were chill. He would explain for like 30 min and the rest of the time it was just solving problems. He would give 5 extra points for every problem you did on the board in front of the class. The tests were identical to the practice exam. Easy A.

Was knowledgeable about the material and lab experiments. Lab manuals weren't as clear as they could be but as long as you submit everything they are asking for while using his report format you will do fine. If you put in effort you should get a good grade.

Dr. G was pressed into teaching this class when Dr. Ilksoy passed away a few weeks into the semester. With no chance to prepare, he did the best he could. He made it a point to make sure everyone had more than a fair chance to pass the course. I saw another post on here for the same Fall 2019 semester who rated him poorly. Remember circumstances.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Took him for thermo. He's not the worst professor I've ever had, but he's very unorganized. You may get called on to solve a problem in front of the class if no one volunteers. I would recommend only taking him if he is the only section available.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His lectures are monotone, but he spices it up by allowing us to solve questions in front of our peers for extra credit. He also will help you when you go up, so you could walk in without knowing anything and still get some credit. He gives quizzes, which he then uses to make tests. But he also gives a study guide, which is the test but re-worded.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr.G is a pretty mellow teacher. As long as you pay attention, he'll like you. his Finals are usually exactly the same as the study guides he gives you before then.  So there's no reason not to make an A in his class, unless you're just lazy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. G gives conceptual quizzes, counts attendance and participation. He only had a few tests, but you could bring in your own formula sheet with whatever you wanted to write down. He teaches with a PPT that is on D2L. You have to pay attention (no doing hw or texting) otherwise, he will ask you to leave.

Guru is a good guy. I agree with another reviewer who said you need to sit close to be able to clearly hear him. He drops all sorts of hints as to what will be on his tests, but he will definitely spring a conceptual quiz on you. I like that he's one of the few teachers left who will tell students who are being disruptive to stop or leave his class
Really nice guy. You need to sit up front because he is very soft spoken. Gives a lot of pop quizzes that are concept questions. Pay close attention when he's reviewing for tests.

So my final is coming up and the only thing we have done so far is take a midterm.. You can't understand him half the time. He does example problems that would be helpful if he didn't get the wrong answer half the time. Very unprepared for class and I'm not even sure he knows what he's doing.

I notice that the 2 people that have already reviewed him selected "Barely cracked open" for the text book. I noticed early on that every single problem he uses in his slides and on the tests are straight out of the textbook. I studied the exact problems that he asked us to study and I got an A in the class.
Most unorganized class I have ever taken.  He gets lost in his problems and grades tests incorrectly.  He is a nice guy, though.

Dr. G is... interesting. He is a very quiet guy. Doesn't always understand the questions that you ask (foreign). Halfway through the semester almost the entire class was left asking themselves what the heck was going on. His lectures aren't very clear.  You. Will. Be. Confused. Fairly easy grader though. I personally  won't take him again.
